title: Emilia Pires appointed by the Secretary-General of United Nations Ban Ki-moon to High-level Panel of Eminent Persons on the post 2015 Development Agenda Â«  Government of Timor-Leste

quotes: Since 2010 Ms Pires has been Chair of the g7+, championing the voice of conflict-affected and post conflict states.

organizations.name: IV Constitutional Government
quotes: including her five years as the Finance Minister in the IV Constitutional Government where she contributed to major economic reforms underpinning ongoing stability and accelerated development.

roles.title: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom
quotes: The co-chairs of the High-level Panel of Eminent Persons are the President of the Republic of Indonesia, His Excellency Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono, the President of the Republic of Liberia, Her Excellency Ellen Johnson-Sirleaf and the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, His Excellency David Cameron.

As Chair, she has worked closely with the People of Timor-Leste as well as other Nations, civil society, the private sector and international partners to identify ways to improve development partnerships and accelerate aid effectiveness.

The co-chairs of the High-level Panel of Eminent Persons are the President of the Republic of Indonesia, His Excellency Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono, the President of the Republic of Liberia, Her Excellency Ellen Johnson-Sirleaf and the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, His Excellency David Cameron.

The co-chairs of the High-level Panel of Eminent Persons are the President of the Republic of Indonesia, His Excellency Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono, the President of the Republic of Liberia, Her Excellency Ellen Johnson-Sirleaf and the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, His Excellency David Cameron.

The co-chairs of the High-level Panel of Eminent Persons are the President of the Republic of Indonesia, His Excellency Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono, the President of the Republic of Liberia, Her Excellency Ellen Johnson-Sirleaf and the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, His Excellency David Cameron.

supporting_quotes: including her five years as the Finance Minister in the IV Constitutional Government where she contributed to major economic reforms underpinning ongoing stability and accelerated development.
assembled_events.notes: No explicit time marker, but the role is clearly a career position.

issues.description: Missing time marker for the career position, making it difficult to place the event in a timeline.
Multiple roles and locations linked to the same organization without clear individual time markers, which may cause ambiguity in event interpretation.
